website_summaries.verdict: Synology's tiny DiskStation DS414slim is a compelling NAS for home and SOHO users who want to protect their data at a reasonable price. If performance is paramount, however, there are speedier options out there.
cons: Some UI compatibility issues with Internet Explorer 11
UI froze a few times in our tests
RAID volume rebuild can be fairly slow

customer_reviews.title: Great NAS for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: This is our first NAS device and setting it up was a breeze. Plug the power and ethernet into the wall, go to find.synology.com, and boom, we were up in <5 minutes. It took about 10 minutes to update software but at no point was I lost in the process. I purchased 4x2.5" WD 1TB Red Drives to pop in and they were already configured for SHR-1 (which is what I was planning on using anyways). I love the small size and the 2.5" drives since they take up so much less space. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: R&D

customer_reviews.title: Great low power NAS
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely great low power, tiny NAS. It does not compete with the average sized 4-5 bay NAS that are more powerful media center oriented NASs. This one, however, sips power and is very frugal. Sure you can't put ultra large capacity HDDs in there, but it will happily take 2TB Samsung spinpoint 2.5" 9.5mm HDDs. I have not seen my electricity bill increase in the slightest since I installed it. I believe this NAS is rated between 11-15 W of power draw; not bad...
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: A very compact file storage box with RAID
customer_reviews.text: The main reason to chose Synology over other brands is their software (in my opinion). This is the third unit I have purchased, so you can call me a fan. Within the Synology line, consider this unit is for its small size and cuteness. It uses laptop drives (or, preferably WD red 2.5" drives). This makes it very compact and a bit quieter than units using 3.5" drives. Each drive fits into a caddy on the back of the unit. The caddies are not screw-less as you might expect, but plenty of screws are included and installation is easy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark THOMPSON

customer_reviews.title: Good product for a small space
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a NAS I end up buying this model because it's small and I wanted that feature over another ones. Works fine, the DSM O.S. seems fine too and has a lot of features and apps to add to the system. Pros: 2 gigabit NICs, small, a lot of features, leds to advise on errors, not noisy. Cons: Sata II, slow raid procedures timings like checking parity and syncing, only 512 ram (but for now, seems it is not a problem really).
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Spadari

customer_reviews.title: More than a NAS.
customer_reviews.text: It's more than a NAS. There are many apps available for download. Most useful for me is the surveillance app. My old Android devices again has purpose as surveillance cameras. FTP and other protocols are also in the options ready to be activated. Note that it can only use 8 cameras for its surveillance app. Two are free and ready to use out of the box. The other six licenses are needed to be bought from online sellers.
customer_reviews.author: EdA

customer_reviews.title: Synology products rock!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this NAS device to replace an aging DROBO unit I've had for about 5 years. It is a much more mature, flexible, and easy to manage product. I have tested it for about a month now and am very impressed with it's quality and the broad variety of software services available on it. I subsequently ordered another, larger, and more powerful unit to run a number of software services on it. (Look out DVD's, VHS tapes, and audio disks. You are going in a box in the attic as soon as I can get you ripped onto this device.)
customer_reviews.author: Paul Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Garbage due to planned obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: The interface is SO slow now, it's unusable. Synology's business model clearly includes planned obsolescence. I won't be buying another product from this sham of a company.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but Synology for me
customer_reviews.text: I have used Iomega and Buffalo in the past. The past three NAS devices have been Synology. Features, manageability, and performance are excellent. If you plan on using many features together, just know that the CPU and RAM makes a huge difference in performance. When in doubt, go with the better hardware.
customer_reviews.author: cruisin'

customer_reviews.title: Like all Synology units
customer_reviews.text: Like all Synology units, this one is great. I tried an experiment of actually placing this unit on the INSIDE of a large Corsair case on top of a drive cage and securing it and then running a cat5e cable in back of the mobo and out a specially made slot for an add-on card. Similar working around for the power. The only problem would be if there was a fire and the whole thing burned up. This unit comes with the full Disk Station Manager software that would cost more than the unit and drives combined so is great to play with and use as a local NAS and use another one elsewhere for very important things...
customer_reviews.author: HENRY B. ROSE

customer_reviews.title: I love my NAS
customer_reviews.text: I love my NAS, installed 4 Seagate 2TB drives and have had this bad boy up and running with link aggregation for the double 1GB/s connections since day 1. It does exactly what it's supposed to and has all the awesome stuff that makes a synology great.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Heiner

customer_reviews.title: It works well!
customer_reviews.text: it works well, nice GUI, and it is actually quite fast even though it has only 1 cpu core. The Quickconnect feature allows connection from outside, without doing any port forwarding, and this is a really nice feature. The Download station works quite well too. The Video station allows you to download subtitle right when viewing the movie, this is a really convenient feature. I prefer this over my older model QNAP TS219.
customer_reviews.author: Cheng Jang Ming

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, Fast, Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent NAS. Ideal to mount WD Red 1To hard drives for a Raid 1. Quiet, no sound at all, really surprising. The speed is excellent and the dual LAN aggregation makes it a must. I was considering a DS214 and finally made a good choice for 4 slots!
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Whats good about this is that it uses laptop hard drives
customer_reviews.text: Whats good about this is that it uses laptop hard drives, they seem to stay cooler and last longer than their 3.5 in cousins. It would be better if they used a stronger cpu. I get near 100 percent cpu usage while transferring files vs their 415+ model.
customer_reviews.author: kevinD

customer_reviews.title: Another highly recommended Synology product!
customer_reviews.text: Synology is great! They make great quality products and stand by them with great support and software updates. I bought this one to back up a six year old Synology that may be nearing end-of-life. This is surprisingly small and relatively fast. I would highly recommend this to my friends.

customer_reviews.title: Great solution!
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to network attached storage but found the set-up and operation of the Synology NAS very simple. I bought it primarily to store my music and movie files which I run through a Plex Media Server on a new Mac Mini. It all works as advertised and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.

customer_reviews.title: Best home network storage I've used
customer_reviews.text: This is now the heart of my home services. It has my movies (ripped from DVD); desktop backups; music; etc. Very solid and easy to use interface.

customer_reviews.title: A nice improvement over its predecessor
customer_reviews.text: A nice improvement over its predecessor. My one complaint over the DS1411slim was that it had a hard time handling high bitrates as a media server on occasion. This version is improved over the predecessor in that regard. Additionally, the software seems more stable. As a sidenote, I am using a crucial 240 gig SSD, which was not on the list of recommended drives but seems the working well.

customer_reviews.text: Could have been 5 stars, but am surprised the fan runs as often as it does, considering I loaded this with 4 SSDs. Must be the smaller size of the fan vs. my larger Synology boxes. I've set the fan to run minimally as needed, but it kicks on coming out of sleep mode?
